Authors:
Digvijayini Bundhun, Rajesh JEEWON, Indunil Chinthani
Senanayake, Erio Camporesi, Janith Vishvakeerthi Aluthmuhandiram, Alvin
M.C. Tang, Ji-Chuan KANG, Vishwakalyan Bhoyroo, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Molecular phylogenetics of Discosia ravennica sp. nov and a
new host record for Sporocadus rosigena
Keywords:
1 new species, Amphisphaeriales, DNA sequences, saprobes,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Collections of two dead leaf specimens from Italy were
subjected to morphological examination. Two coelomycetous taxa belonging
to two different genera in Xylariomycetidae, Sordariomycetes, namely
Discosia and Sporocadus, were identified. Multi-locus phylogenies based
on the nuclear ribosomal large subunit (LSU), Internal Transcribed
Spacer (ITS) and Î²-tubulin (tub2) sequence data revealed that the
Discosia species is basal to D. neofraxinea and forms an independent
lineage. The latter is also different from other Discosia species by its
unilocular to bilocular, superficial and applanate conidiomata along
with elongate-ampulliform conidiogenous cells attenuated at the base and
conidia smaller in size. It is introduced as Discosia ravennica sp.nov.
Our second taxon collected is a new host record from Italy and
morphological observations coupled with multigene phylogeny support that
it is Sporocadus rosigena. Descriptions, illustrations and molecular
data for both species are provided in this paper.
